name: February 2021 pharmaceutical M&A round-up
introduction: There were not many acquisitions in the pharmaceutical industry in February, but three of them were in the billion dollar-plus category.
content:
There were not many acquisitions in the pharmaceutical industry in February, but three of them were in the billion dollar-plus category.

The biggest of all was the largest of the year so far, with Jazz Pharmaceuticals (Nasdaq: JAZZ) paying $7.2 billion to buy cannabis company GW Pharmaceuticals.

Our table below documents the month's acquisitions:

Company Takeover candidate Value Why?
Horizon Therapeutics Viel Bio $3.05 billion To expand Horizon's pipeline in order to accelerate its growth over the long term
Jazz Pharmaceuticals GW Pharmaceuticals $7.2 billion To add an industry-leading cannabinoid platform, innovative pipeline and products, to strengthen and broaden Jazz's neuroscience portfolio
Novo Holdings Altasciences Undisclosed To acquire a company that is well-positioned to capture share in the fast-growing market for drug development services
Beam Therapeutics Guide Therapeutics $120 million plus $320 million in milestones To further expand the potential reach of Beam’s genetic medicines into new target tissues and diseases
Merck & Co Pandion Therapeutics $1.85 billion To build upon Merck’s strategy to identify and secure candidates with differentiated and potentially foundational characteristics
